title: Why did I get banned?
body:
I have been platinum since Season 3-5 and now all of a sudden I'm getting banned?  I have played this game since Season 1 so I'm very disappointed with this random ban.. 

I admit yes I have not played any rank games for a while since the ONLY reason I even played ranked again was to keep my Platinum border, which I really didn't wanna lose.

I've recently been teaching my friend that is NEW to league how to play in a bots game so I don't ruin other peoples experience in a normal playing against a level 30 platinum player.  So just because I plat bot games to HELP my friend I'm getting banned? That is the only reason I even played league this whole month in all honesty to teach my friend and now I'm getting banned for a suspicious MMR boost? 

Guess I can't play bots with my friend anymore that I really love to be around.  I appreciate it though Riot, I'll be taking my break now, take away my border, do what you want. I don't even care, I'm not quitting but I'm not paying another dollar on the game.

There's nothing wrong with playing bot games and helping a friend get into the game or teach them. This is something that we encourage.

So, your account can be banned if someone else plays on it at all. However, I don't really think you are gonna get banned if someone played only normals on your account (I might be wrong on this one, not entirely sure what's the Riot policy on this).

I think something is wrong with your message. Did you try to make new lines manually?

And I get what you're saying, but you should try talking to Riot about their policy on such things, as users can't really help you, especially since you were more or less rightfully banned (even if you didn't realize this at the time).

I would really take some time and sent a ticket to Riot, but I doubt they will change their mind now (they may however give you insight on what's okay and what's punishable for future reference).

And on another note - I disagree with your stance about ranked games. Even if your skill level is close, or the "booster" couldn't win games it still hurts the competitive nature of League (just because you weren't the one that played that ranked game) - this shouldn't be a problem if it's literally one or two games, but if it happens more often it should be punished.

That said... I do believe that the punishment should be scaled to the level of the offense. For example, someone that got only a few games played by another players (especially if he didn't move in the ladder) should be just rolled back, get ranked restriction for a couple of games and a warning, rather than removing past and current rewards along with a ban.

However, I presume that Riot's detection of those things is not accurate enough to create a system like that - which is a pity.
